subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|alt=僊,仚,屳}}
A relatively late word, perhaps {{der|zh|sit}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). Compare {{cog|bo|གཤེན||shaman}}, as in {{cog|bo|གཤེན་རབ||Shenrab}}, the founder of the Tibetan religion {{w|Bon}}, although this might be a loan from Chinese ([[ibid]].). {{zh-ref|Starostin}} sets up {{inh|zh|sit-pro||*s[ă]n|a kind of demon}}, comparing it to {{cog|bo|བསེན་མོ||female devil}} and {{cog|kac|sawn||malignant female [[nat]]}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|仙界|せんかい}}: dwelling place of hermits
* {{ja-r|仙客|せんかく}}: immortal mountain wizard, crane
* {{ja-r|仙宮|せんきゅう}}: hermit's residence, retired emperor's palace
* {{ja-r|仙境|せんきょう}}, {{ja-r|仙郷|せんきょう}}: fairyland, enchanted land
* {{ja-r|仙窟|せんくつ}}: enchanted cave
* {{ja-r|仙骨|せんこつ}}: sacrum, sacral bone; hermitry
* {{ja-r|仙術|さんじゅつ}}: wizardry, secret of immortality
* {{ja-r|仙女|せんじょ}}, {{ja-r|仙女|せんにょ}}: fairy, nymph, elf
* {{ja-r|仙台|^せんだい}}: Sendai city
* {{ja-r|仙丹|せんたん}}: elixir, elixir of life
* {{ja-r|仙椎|せんつい}}: sacral vertebra
* {{ja-r|仙人|せんにん}}: immortal mountain wizard, mountain man
* {{ja-r|仙翁|せんのう}}: ''[[Lychnis]]'' species
* {{ja-r|仙薬|せんやく}}: panacea, elixir of life
* {{ja-r|仙蓼|せんりょう}}: {{taxlink|Sarcandra glabra|species|noshow=1}} (formerly {{taxlink|Chloranthus glaber|species|noshow=1}})
* {{ja-r|仙人掌|さぼてん}}: cactus
* {{ja-r|仙%花紙|せん%かし}}: reclaimed paper
* {{ja-r|仙台侯|せんだいこう}}: Lord of Sendai
* {{ja-r|仙洞 御所|せんとう ごしょ}}: palace of a retired emperor
* {{ja-r|仙台 虫喰|せんだい むしくい}}: {{vern|eastern crowned warbler}}
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|求仙|きゅうせん}}, {{ja-r|九仙|きゅうせん}}, {{ja-r|気宇仙|きゅうせん}}: {{vern|multicolorfin rainbowfish}}
* {{ja-r|詩仙|しせん}}: great poet
* {{ja-r|神仙|しんせん}}: immortal mountain wizard, Taoist immortal, supernatural being
* {{ja-r|酒仙|しゅせん}}: heavy drinker
* {{ja-r|水仙|すいせん}}: [[daffodil]], [[narcissus]]
* {{ja-r|登仙|とうせん}}: becoming a saint, death of a high-ranking person
* {{ja-r|銘仙|めいせん}}: meisen silk
* {{ja-r|腰仙|ようせん}}: lumbosacral
* {{ja-r|天仙果|いぬびわ}}: {{taxlink|Ficus erecta|species|noshow=1}}, species of ficus
* {{ja-r|鳳%仙%花|ほう%せん%か}}: [[balsam]]
* {{ja-r|雲%仙%岳|^うん%ぜん%だけ}}: mountain in Nagasaki Prefecture
* {{ja-r|三%仙%叉|さん%せん%さ}}: trident dagger
* {{ja-r|画%仙%紙|が%せん%し}}: drawing paper
* {{ja-r|中%仙%道|^なか%せん%どう}}: Nakasendo, Edo-period Edo-Kyoto highway
* {{ja-r|阿%仙薬|あ%せん%やく}}: [[gambir]], [[gambier]], [[catechu]], [[cutch]]
* {{ja-r|神仙 思%想|しんせん し%そう}}: Shenxian thought
* {{ja-r|黄%水%仙|き%ずい%せん}}, {{ja-r|黄%水%仙|き%すい%せん}}: [[jonquil]]
* {{ja-r|夏%水%仙|なつ%ずい%せん}}: {{vern|belladonna lily}}
* {{ja-r|羽化 登仙|うか とうせん}}: sense of release
* {{ja-r|鍾%馗%水%仙|しょう%き%ずい%せん}}: {{taxlink|Lycoris aurea|species|noshow=1}} (formerly {{taxlink|Lycoris traubii|species|noshow=1}}), species of [[spider lily]]
* {{ja-r|喇%叭%水%仙|らっ%ぱ%ずい%せん}}: {{vern|trumpet daffodil}}
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|せん}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=せん}} {{m|zh|仙|tr=sjen|lit=immortal}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''xiān'' and {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''sin<sup>1</sup>''.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|せん}}

# a [[sage]] or [[hermit]], an [[enlightened]] person, usually [[immortal]] and [[ageless]]
# {{lb|ja|mythology|sort=せん}} short for {{m|ja|仙人|tr=sennin}}: a [[wizard]] or [[mage]]; an [[immortal]] living as a [[hermit]] in the [[mountains]]
# by extension, the region or area where a ''sennin'' lives
# the [[supernatural]] techniques for becoming [[immortal]] and [[ageless]]
# a person of [[exceptional]] [[talent]]

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|せんと}}
Borrowed from {{bor|ja|en|sort=せん|cent}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> The kanji spelling is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]].

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|セント|せんと}}

# one hundredth of a [[dollar]]: a [[cent]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This word is almost always spelled in katakana as {{l|ja|セント}}.
